faqs.question: Are there specific legal documents needed when buying a shop in Sector 38
faqs.answer: Standard documents include the Agreement to Sell the Sale Deed the Occupancy Certificate (OC) or Completion Certificate (CC) provided by the developer and necessary property tax receipts. Our team ensures thorough due diligence covering all these crucial legal aspects before any transaction is finalized.

faqs.question: Should I look for a pre-leased shop or a vacant unit for better returns
faqs.answer: Pre-leased shops offer immediate guaranteed income and remove the risk of vacancy appealing to conservative investors seeking immediate cash flow. The choice depends entirely on your specific investment timeline and risk appetite.

faqs.question: How does infrastructure impact the long-term value of a shop for sale in Sector 38
faqs.answer: Superior infrastructure including ample underground parking 24/7 power backup modern HVAC systems and excellent maintenance significantly enhances the tenant appeal and lifespan of the commercial property. faqs.question: What are the associated maintenance costs and charges for commercial properties
faqs.answer: Commercial maintenance charges cover common area electricity security cleaning lift operation and shared utility upkeep. These charges are typically higher than residential maintenance due to the intensity of usage but are often passed on to the tenant as part of the lease agreement. Investors should budget for common area charges generally calculated per square foot per month.
